definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: It was an impressive humility, because it was completely genuine.
sentences.chinese: 這種真實的謙卑實在令人激賞。

sentences.english: Tributes have been paid to a dog who shot to fame for taking the bus to his local pub.
sentences.chinese: 一條狗因爲搭巴士到當地的酒館而成名，受到激賞。

sentences.english: The crowd showed its appreciation by clapping and cheering.
sentences.chinese: 羣衆以拍手和歡呼表示激賞。

sentences.english: It is indeed an admirable face-object.
sentences.chinese: 這確是一張令人激賞的臉。

sentences.english: This ring is the exciting evolution of a celebrated collection.
sentences.chinese: 這款戒指是一知名系列最令人激賞的作品。

definition: lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), literary academic and novelist, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
joy of first experience (idiom)/the pleasure of reading sth for the first time
